title: ExcelSUM Function

metadata.description: Learn about ExcelSUM Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel
SUM Function

SUM Function
The
SUM
function is a premade function in Excel
content_sections.content: , which adds numbers in a range.

content_sections.title: The
content_sections.content:
=SUM
function adds cells in a range, both negative and positive.

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=SUM
Double click the
SUM
command
Select a range
Hit enter
Let's see some examples!
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting		305
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465
    Onix	Rock	Ground	385
    Dragonair	Dragon		420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349
    Rattata	Normal		253
    Charmeleon	Fire		405
    Gastly	Ghost	Poison	310
    Magikarp	Water		200
Copy Values
Great job!

content_sections.title: You have successfully calculated the sum of the stats using the
content_sections.content:
=SUM
function. The Pokemon's stats have a total sum of
3092
.
Let's change one of the values in the range, to see what happens. Type
D7(350)
:
Rattata
total stats was changed from
(D7)253
to
(D7)350
.
The
SUM
function updated the total sum from
D12(3092)
to
D12(3189)
.
It updates the
SUM
when values inside of the range are changed.
Lets change
Rattata
stats to a negative number to see what happens. Type
D7(-350)
:
The
SUM
is updated to
D12(2489)
. Adding a negative number subtracts that value from the range.

content_sections.title: The
content_sections.content:
=SUM
function adds both positive and negative numbers.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting		305
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465

    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349

summary: This tutorial covers ExcelSUM Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ExcelSUM Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ExcelSUM Function and how to apply it in your projects.
